abstracts.cdata!:
The loan supports institutional and
            policy reforms directed at reducing the dominance of the
            public sector in the economy; improving the competitive
            environment for the private sector; increasing the
            efficiency of and rationalizing pricing policy in public
            enterprises (PEs); promoting clarity, transparency, and
            accountability in the relationship between the Central
            Government and PEs; and laying a base for stronger public
            finances over the medium and longer term.  Its medium-term
            policy goals include a substantial increase in the
            participation of the private sector in the economy;
            expansion of private investment, both national and foreign,
            in all sectors; establishment of a level playing field and
            maintenance of market discipline for both public and private
            enterprises in commercial sectors; minimizing PE monopoly
            powers and establishing regulatory mechanisms; and
            substantial reduction of general Government transfers to
            public enterprises over the medium term.  Over the next two
            years, the reform program will focus on the restructuring of
            about 11 priority PEs, the privatization of about 100 PEs,
            and the establishment of clear and transparent institutional
            relationships between the Central Government and the
            remaining PEs.
